headline: Kogi gov, shield of APC, says Senate President
summarized_story:
The President of the Senate, Ahmad Lawan, on Thursday described the Kogi State Governor, Yahaya Bello, as the “shield” of the ruling All Progressives Congress.
According to a statement on Thursday, Lawan spoke during the inauguration of Senator Yakubu Oseni’s constituency projects across Kogi Central.
“The Governor of Kogi State, , Alhaji Yahaya Bello is the Shield of APC in Nigeria, and therefore he is the Sarkin Yaki of APC in Nigeria,” the Senate President was quoted as saying.
He noted that the 600 capacity JAMB CBT centre facilitated by Oseni would have generational impacts on the teeming youths of Kogi Central who seek admission to schools of higher learning.
The governor, who was represented by his deputy, Edward Onoja, also noted that Oseni’s legacy projects across Kogi Central had been unprecedented.

headline: 50-year-old development plan will drive Anambra transformation – Soludo
summarized_story:
Anambra State Governor-elect, Prof Chukwuma Soludo, has presented the Anambra 50-year Development Plan to Governor Willie Obiano.
Soludo, who is the Chairman of the Development-Plan drafting committee made the handover at the valedictory session of the Obiano administration held at the International Convention Centre, Awka, on Thursday.
He said the document would provide the development trajectory of the state in the next five decades.
He said the Obiano administration had laid a solid foundation for the economic transformation of Anambra, adding that he would continue in that stride as the All Progressives Grand Alliance was a party with a people-oriented manifesto.
Receiving the document, Obiano thanked the Soludo-led committee for executing the 30-month task with commitment and altruism.

headline: Ebonyi: Gov Umahi, deputy apply for stay of execution of judgment
summarized_story:

They are further seeking an order restraining INEC from conducting elections into their offices and or declaraing the names of any candidate presented by the PDP as the governor and deputy governor of Ebonyi state.
The application was filed before Justice Inyang Ekwo, who delivered the judgment that is being challenged at the appellate court.
Umahi and his deputy told the court that they were totally dissatisfied with the judgment and have accordingly gone before the appellate court to challenge it.
They maintained that the outcome of their appeal would be rendered nugatory, unless the court suspends the execution of the judgment.

headline: Jonathan addresses ECOWAS Parliament, charges lawmakers to protect democratic values
summarized_story:
The former President stated this while addressing the First Extraordinary Session of the Fifth ECOWAS Parliament which has just ended in Monrovia, Liberia.
Describing the Parliament as the soul and heart of democracy, Dr Jonathan urged the parliamentarians to seek to protect democracy in West Africa by making laws that would guarantee the independence of the electoral management bodies, ensure electronic voting, safeguard rule of law and protect constitutional term limits.
Speaking on the place of credible elections in a democracy, Dr. Jonathan stated: “The parliament should seriously consider the imperative of protecting the independence of electoral management bodies to ensure that electoral processes are transparent, free, fair and acceptable to stakeholders.
We have to grow our democracy to a level where people will believe that their votes will count.
For democracy to serve the people well, Dr. Jonathan further noted that development, economic growth and welfare of citizens have to be prioritised by leaders.

headline: IWD: Why we represent women’s struggles, experiences in a photo exhibition — Feminist media
summarized_story:
…As Document Women marks one year anniversary in styleBy Ebunoluwa SessouA feminist organisation, Document Women, the women-focused media striving to immortalise women’s impact on society by creating and engaging feminist content representing women’s struggles, experiences and accomplishments, celebrated its one year anniversary with a photo exhibition and a documentary on 2022 International Women’s Day, at the British Deputy High Commissioner’s Residence, in Lagos.
Since its inception, Document Women has been known to amplify women’s voices and inspire wide-reaching conversations on women’s issues using a gendered lens.
“In its first year, Document Women published over 300 articles, produced a podcast series and a short film directed by Emmy.
“On the 8th of March, 2022, Document Women celebrated its first year anniversary with a photo exhibition and documentary series themed “Women Giants”, with photography led by Kudirat Ikharo and Sarah Etta’s debut as a creative director.
At the reception held at the British Deputy High Commissioner’s Residence, Document Women also announced its rebrand by showcasing its new logo, typography, and brand colours on all digital and print assets.

headline: Fiscal Responsibility Commission urged to investigate loan by Akwa Ibom govt
summarized_story:
A Civil Society Organisation promoting fiscal responsibility in Niger Delta, Policy Alert has urged the Fiscal Responsibility Commission (FRC) to investigate serial loans acquired by the Akwa Ibom State government without following due process.
The organisation on Thursday in a statement by its Programme Officer, Faith Paulinus, noted that the loans obtained by the state government in succession breached the Fiscal Responsibility Act 2007 and the Akwa Ibom State Fiscal Responsibility Law 2020.
The group accused both the legislature and the executive arm of government of collusion to impose an unsustainable debt burden on the state.
According to the statement, “the Fiscal Responsibility Commission should launch an investigation into the loan approval processes of Akwa Ibom government.
The organisation also decried the state government’s spending on interest payments for these loans, noting that the sudden spike in interest payments for 2021 indicates an irregularity.

summarized_story:
Nigeria Governors Forum (NGF) Chairman, Kayode Fayemi, says governors’ monthly security vote are used to support security agencies.
Fayemi spoke on Thursday in Abuja at a stakeholders meeting on ‘Peace and Inclusive Security Initiative’.

headline: Jet fuel now N670 per litre from N170 – Airline operators cry out
summarized_story:
Mr. Onyema, while appearing before the House of Representatives Committee investigating the increase in price of the fuel, said the operators now buy the fuel for N670 per litre from the N190 per litre they used to buy.
Onyema said the NNPC limited should be asked to bring down the price of the fuel to N200 per litre so that the operators can continue to operate.
Responding to the request, NNPC Limited CEO, Mele Kyari said the request will not be possible.
Kyari stressed that the fuel is a deregulated product and the landing cost is N418 per litre.
He directed the NNPC limited boss to work with all relevant authorities to crash the price of jet fuel.

headline: Fuel scarcity: Rivers govt confirms arrival of petrol vessel in Port Harcourt
summarized_story:
The Rivers State Government has confirmed the arrival of a vessel containing petrol at the Port Harcourt depot.
This is coming amid continued scarcity of petrol across the state.
The state Commissioner for Energy and Natural Resources, Doctor Peter Medee, who gave the confirmation in an interview with newsmen, said the vessel contains enough petrol that will serve Rivers people and end the current fuel scarcity in the state.
He said, “I’m glad to announce today that we received a report that the vessel we have been waiting for has arrived at the Port Harcourt depot.
As of Thursday evening, queues have continued to build up in some filling stations that are dispensing petrol.

summarized_story:

The beauty pageant was held within the NCoS’ Kirikiri facility on Tuesday, March 8, 2022.
But the NCoS Lagos State Command said the pageant was only one of several other activities organised to mark International Women’s Day (IWD).
The Command’s spokesman, Rotimi Oladokun, told The Nation that the pageant and all the other events were open to all female inmates, whether convicted or awaiting trial.
But in line with International Women’s Day, the female custodial facilities commemorated International Women’s Day with inmates, various inmates without distinction or discrimination against anybody – an inmate is an inmate.

headline: Kidnapper rejects N200,000 share, reports to police
summarized_story:
A disgruntled self-confessed kidnapper, Sadu Bunkawu, has turned down N200,000 he was given after their last operation and reported the gang to the police.
Bunkawu, 28, told police in Adamawa State that they got N12 million from families of their victims, out of which he was given a meagre N200,000.
“I lost my share of the money while rushing home,” Bunkawu said.
“The money was paid to seven of us by the family members of the victims.
After releasing them, I was called and given N200,000 only,”The Police Command has arraigned Bunkawu before Chief Magistrate Court I in Yola on charge of criminal conspiracy and kidnapping.

headline: Banks suspend ATM, PoS transactions abroad
summarized_story:
Deposit Money Banks (DMBs) have announced temporary suspension of overseas Automated Teller Machine (ATM) card services and Point of Sale (PoS) transactions.
The banks’ decision followed consistent dollar scarcity and challenges faced by manufacturers and real sector operators in sourcing foreign exchange from the economy.
The bank said: “Please be informed that we have temporary suspended the use of Zenith Bank Naira cards for International Automated Teller Machine (ATM) cash withdrawals and PoS transactions.
Both banks advised their customers seeking to carry out transactions denominated in foreign exchange to apply for dollar or pounds sterling debit credit cards.
Banking sources said banks were increasingly finding it difficult to fund their foreign-currency denominated services, especially online forex transactions and overseas ATM withdrawals, as well as PoS usage overseas by customers.

headline: Senate rejects request to amend new Electoral Act

From Fred Itua, AbujaSenate, yesterday, rejected an Executive Bill transmitted by President Muhammadu Buhari to amend the Electoral Act signed into law on February 25.

headline: UK Stops Abramovich from Selling Chelsea
summarized_story:
Attempts by Russian billionaire, Roman Abramovich, to sell Chelsea has been halted by the UK government.
Abramovich had put up the European champions for sale in the wake of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and as threats of sanctions were speculated.
But Thursday, the UK government ruled that Abramovich, who is one of the 10 Russian Oligarchs whose assets have been frozen, cannot sell the club.
The freezing of Abramovich’s assets, which include Chelsea, means the club cannot sell further match tickets.
Top football sources in the UK insisted that the move by the Boris Johnson administration means that Abramovich cannot make money from the sale of Chelsea.

headline: Let Umahi Sue Me For Defamation, I Have Said What I Have Said” – Abia Onyike
summarized_story:
After his intemperate outburst over his removal as governor of Ebonyi State by a Federal High Court in Abuja, David Umahi has proceeded to the Court of Appeal seeking a reversal of the ruling of the trial court.
RelatedStories No Content AvailableHowever, Umahi’s choice of words did not escape the Nigerian Bar Association, which expressed utter dismay over what it described as his “unfortunate and totally unacceptable reaction” to the court ruling and the trial judge, Justice Inyang Ekwo.
The NBA went on to demand an immediate apology from the governor and a retraction of his comments against the person and judgement of Justice Ekwo of the Federal High Court.
To discuss the fallout of the ruling removing Umahi and Kelechi Igwe as governor and deputy governor of Ebonyi State respectively, as well unfolding political developments in the state, is Abia Onyike, a former Ebonyi State Commissioner for Information.

headline: UK Freezes Chelsea Owner Roman Abramovich’s Assets, Club Sale and Ticket Sales Stopped
summarized_story:
The government, in announcing its actions against Abramovich and six other Russian oligarchs, said it had taken steps to ensure Chelsea would be able to continue its operations and complete its schedule.
To protect the club’s interests, the government said, it issued Chelsea a license to continue its soccer-related activities, including a Premier League match at Norwich City on Thursday night.
That ban also could make it impossible for Abramovich to follow through on his previously announced plans to sell Chelsea.

headline: Nigeria: APC Senators Insist Yobe Governor Buni Remains Party Chairman – Arise News
summarized_story:
Senators elected on the platform of the All Progressives Congress (APC), on Wednesday, after a closed-door meeting for about three hours, insisted that the Yobe State Governor, Mai Mala Buni, remained the Chairman of the Caretaker/Extraordonary Convention Planning Committee (CECPC) of the party.
The reported storm in the party by the media is not true as there was no leadership crisis.
“Governor Buni, to us, remains the Chairman of National Caretaker/ Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee of the Party.
But a source privy to the meeting told THISDAY that not only did the senators support the sack of Buni, they also ratified the new national planning committee of the party.
The caucus further resolved to meet with CECPC of the party, leaders of the Governors Forum and aspirants/candidates, starting from tomorrow, Friday.

headline: No Preferred Bidder Yet for Nigeria Air, Government Clarifies
summarized_story:
Nigeria’s federal government on Wednesday said it was yet to appoint any bidder for the proposed Nigeria Air even as it stated that it had at no time selected nor appointed either entity nor individual as preferred bidder for the project.
The government through the Ministry of Aviation, made this known in a statement made available to journalists in Abuja.
The statement by the Director, Public Affairs, Ministry of Aviation, James Odaudu, read: “Our attention has been drawn to reports in some media to the effect that Qatar Airways has been chosen as the preferred bidder for Nigeria’s national carrier, Nigeria Air.
“We wish to state categorically that no corporate entity or individual has been appointed or selected, or even preferred for the project as the process for selection has just started with the Request for Proposal.
“Finally, we wish to appeal to media practitioners to always confirm information from the right quarters before going to press so as to avoid misleading the public.”
